raw_text:
Clijsters hope on Aussie Open
 
 Kim Clijsters has denied reports that she has pulled out of January's Australian Open because of her persistent wrist injury.
 
 Open chief Paul McNamee had said: "Kim's wrist obviously isn't going to be rehabilitated." But her spokesman insisted she had simply delayed submitting her entry. "The doctors are assessing her injury on a weekly basis and if there is no risk she could play. But if there's the least risk she will stay away." Despite being absent from the WTA entry list for the tournament, which begins on 17 January, Clijsters would be certain to get a wild card if she requested one. Clijsters is still ranked 22nd in the world despite only playing a handful of matches last season. The Belgian had an operation on her left wrist early in the season but injured it again on her return to the tour. Meanwhile, Jelena Dokic, who used to compete for Australia, has opted out of the first Grand Slam of the season. Dokic has not played in the Australian Open since 2001 when she lost in the first round. But the 21-year-old would have had to rely on a wild card next season because her ranking has tumbled to 127th. Four-time champion Monica Seles, who has not played since last year's French Open, is another absentee because of an injured left foot.
llama3.2:1b: Kim Clijsters denied reports she'd leave Australian Open due to wrist injury.
Her spokesman said she might stay away but would reassess weekly.
llama3.2:3b: Kim Clijsters denies reports she pulled out of the Australian Open due to a persistent wrist injury, stating she delayed submitting her entry for assessment by doctors on a weekly basis.
gemma2:2b: Kim Clijsters will likely miss the Australian Open due to her wrist injury, which was assessed weekly by doctors.
Jelena Dokic and Monica Seles are also absent from the tournament due to injuries (Dokic's ranking has dropped significantly) or last season's form, respectively.
Clijsters' absence would likely be filled with a wild card entry if she chooses to play.

She can still compete in the first Grand Slam season (Australian Open), where she has not played since 2001 and is ranked 127th overall.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Belgian tennis player Kim Clijsters withdrew from January's Australian Open after reported wrist injury; her request for a wildcard unlikely to be granted as doctors assess risk.
Dociech opted out due to ranking drop.

Her spokesman claims she delayed submitting her entry; however, if doctors assess no risk, she could play with a wild card.
Despite ranking 22nd, Clijsters played few matches last season.
She underwent an operation early in the season but injured it again when returning to tour.
Jelena Dokic, who used to compete for Australia, has opted out due to her low ranking (127th) and injury since last season's Australian Open.
Monica Seles, another absentee with an injured foot, is also absent after not playing since last year's French Open.

Despite being absent from the WTA entry list for the tournament, which begins on 17 January, Kim would be certain to get a wild card if she requested one.
Despite her injuries, she is still ranked 22nd in the world despite only playing a handful of matches last season.
With no record since 2001 when she lost in the first round, she would have had to rely on a wild card next season because her ranking has tumbled to 127th.

tinydolphin:1.1b: Clijsters, the Belgian tennis star who was expected to compete at the Australian Open in January, has been holding up her entry into the tournament due to her ongoing wrist injury.
Although the Australian Open chief stated that Clijsters's wrist was no longer a concern, her spokesperson has since denied this claim and insists she will play if allowed.
However, Clijsters remains uncertain about her participation in the tournament, as she is not yet ranked enough to secure a wild card if she were to request one.

Meanwhile, Jelena Dokic and Monica Seles, both former Australian Open competitors, have opted out of this year's event due to injuries: Dokic has a ranking of 127th, while Seles, the four-time champion, is dealing with an injured left foot.
